meanings.definition: The state or condition of being imminent.
meanings.sent1: The imminences of the storm made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The imminences of the exam caused anxiety among the students.
meanings.sent3: The imminences of the party had everyone excited to attend.
meanings.sent4: The imminences of the deadline loomed over the project like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The imminences of the volcano eruption were evident in the trembling ground.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The imminences of the celebration filled the air with anticipation.
meanings.sent2: The imminences of the decision being made kept everyone on edge.
meanings.sent3: The imminences of the surprise party leaked out, ruining the secret.
meanings.sent4: The imminences of the sunrise painted the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The imminences of the new year brought hope for better days ahead.

meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being impending.
meanings.sent1: The imminences of the meeting made everyone prepare their presentations.
meanings.sent2: The imminences of the storm led to the evacuation of the coastal areas.
meanings.sent3: The imminences of the surprise gift made her curious about what it could be.
meanings.sent4: The imminences of the concert filled the venue with excited chatter.
meanings.sent5: The imminences of the decision being announced kept everyone in suspense.
